headline: Billionaires Couldn't Get Enough of This ETF in 2024. Is It Right for You in 2025?
summary: It might surprise you to learn that many top investors buy shares of ETFs, including the most popular type of index fund, the S&P 500 index fund.  Among those that own the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF are Ken Griffin's Citadel Advisors, Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway, and Leon Cooperman, and a number of other billionaires own shares of other S&P 500 ETFs such as the SPDR S&P 500 ETF (NYSEMKT: SPY) and the iShares Core S&P 500 ETF (NYSEMKT: IVV).  Whether you're a beginning investor or an expert, the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF is an easy addition to your portfolio, and it's a low-cost option with an expense ratio of just 0.03%.
